description:
Great pizza. Extremely friendly service. Just everything here was perfect. 

The folks making online reservations without even being there was a bit annoying but hey we're all busy. The staff were very good about not seating people till the whole party was present. One person adamantly complained saying the rest of the party was "almost here" and the staff stayed composed and friendly but maintained their policy. Since we were waiting with a full group I really appreciated the professionalism of the staff.
author: Marc R.

description:
I love everything about this place. Food was great, service is amazing and the restaurant itself is soooo cute, especially with the outdoor patio space.

I went for a Saturday dinner with a couple friends and we had the best time! There's a bit of a wait, so we put our names down and had a few drinks at some nearby bars. Once we were seated, our server Matt was a total delight and recommended the meatballs, arancini and Moto pizza. We decided to get those items as well as the seasonal burrata dish, the cavatelli and a bottle of wine!

The appetizers came out very quickly and the meal was well-paced. Matt was funny and engaging and provided the right amount of attentiveness- not overbearing but still present! 

The food was very tasty- the standouts were the burrata, meatballs, and moto pizza. The meatballs were very flavorful and juicy, and the tart yogurt sauce kept the dish from being too heavy. The burrata was AMAZING and was complimented by the nectarines. The Moto pizza was really interesting and flavorful, and I liked the crust of the pizza more than the pizza crust at Beretta. I was a little disappointed they only had one pasta option but that just means that we need to eat more pizza the next time we come here! Definitely not a bad compromise. 

The restaurant is on the smaller side, so I'd recommend only coming with a party of 4 or less if you're not sitting outside. Overall, I think this is a great spot to go with close friends or on a date. The atmosphere is super pleasant and all of the wait-staff is really nice and personable.
author: Michelle V.

description:
We celebrated a friend's birthday there last night and had a ton of everything.  Salads, pizzas, a pasta and desserts.  

Everything was great, service was very attentive and friendly.   I didn't actually eat the desserts - but considering nothing was left - I assume they were good too.
author: Madhuri K.

description: We were seated in the garden while they prepared our table. We ordered a bottle of wine and they led us to a table in front near the window. Our salad was fresh and the pizza was incredible although it fidn't need red onions. We'll be back and highly recommend Ragazza.
author: Mark S.

description: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and despite a 45 minute wait time (which we spent in a pleasant backyard patio), was an overall enjoyable experience. Our party of 3 split the Bianca and Moto and it left us all feeling full and satisfied. The Bianca pizza was extremely flavorful and had a fantastic blend of toppings. While the Moto pizza wasn't quite as good, and the middle of the pie was mildly soggy, it was still a top quality pizza. The restaurant had a great feel to it, a young, hip ambiance.
author: Nick L.

description: I'm sad that I didn't frequent this place more when I lived so close to it. Having their waitlist on Yelp is a huge conscience. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. Pizza was delicious. The real star was the heirloom tomato and brown butter appetizer. Wow! The flavor was out of this world. I almost licked the plate but then remembered I was in a restaurant and not in my home. Great neighborhood restaurant and a very cute back patio to wait until your name is called.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Almost a guaranteed wait, no matter what day of the week, but a very solid spot for pizza, pasta, and wine. The amatriciana stands out among some very solid pizzas. They also have an asparagus and ricotta cavatelli that will knock your socks off. Good for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike, vegans steer clear.

Only open for dinner.
author: Neha S.

description:
Went here on a weekday evening with a friend, got a table in a few mins which was nice! We were starved, so we jumped straight to mains.

They have a good sized menu of pies/pizzas, many of which are surprisingly vegetarian. They have 3 pastas on the menu one of which is vegetarian. I asked for one on the meat pastas minus the meat which they were nice enough to do - many Italian places don't. It was rigatoni with tomato sauce, mushrooms and aubergine. This is hands down one of the best pastas I have ever had!!!

It was perfectly cooked, with a lot of tomato sauce and perfectly done veggies. Sprinkle parmesan on the top and pepper flakes if you like the spice, and it's out of the world. (It's on the pricey side but definitely worth it)
author: Vignesh B.

description:
So I had not written a review before but I should have.  I absolutely loved this place. When asked about favorite Italian places in SF - I would respond that I didn't like most of them but ragazza was the closest place to an Italian restaurant that I liked. 

Things changed tonight. Their Moto pizza that I've had every time I've been there was garbage. No umami, was a chore to eat the bland sausages balls and the Portabella mushroom was tough.  

We asked for Parmesan and chilly flakes - she said right back but never returned. We had to scrape all the toppings off the pizza and just eat the bread (with the lamb meatballs which were really good).  I honestly don't know how such an amazing pizza came out so inedible. And as she never returned - we couldn't provide any feedback nor get anything that could help it.  We left hungry (reflected in my tip) and walked to poppeys chicken a few blocks up and got some chicken which we had to eat at the bus stop because they were closing. 

Im not going to go back after that - so so sad to given how much I used to like them (and their service).  That just gives me an opportunity to hit all the other new spots in that hood.
author: reza n.

description: Love-Love-Looovvvveeee this place. Not just the food, but because of the incredibly charming professional servers. What a fun bunch. Menu changes seasonally and always offers fun and creative surprised. Prepare to wait if you come with a party of 2+ on a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Dawn C.

description:
A friend and I came here on a Wednesday night as a last minute dinner decision, since we happened to be in the area. We arrived around  8 and the restaurant was pretty busy. Luckily, a party was just about to leave when we arrived. If you like your personal space, this is not the place for you. The restaurant isn't too big, so the 2-4 person tables are set up pretty close together. 

We ordered the rigatoni with rustic fresh tomato sauce and the Moto pie. I was excited for the pie since it looked so good in pictures, but was quite disappointed. It lacked a little flavor for me. It tasted like an average mushroom pizza. The rigatoni on the otherhand gave me the complete opposite reaction. I usually don't care for pastas with tomato sauce, but I loved the rigatoni. That was the real winner of the night. My friend and I were basically trying to lick our plate clean of the sauce, without seeming too obvious that that's what we were trying to do. I would come back here just for the rigatoni, although I don't think they always have it. 

If you have a choice, ask to be seated in the outdoor patio! I checked it out after I was done eating and wished that I had. It's super cute outside. It's all lit up, and you sit in a heated tent.
author: Lucinda H.

description: Upscale and affordable. I really enjoyed the Bianca pizza, which I initially tried to order with some additional toppings, but the waiter was polite and asked if I had eaten the Bianca, which I had not, and requested I tried it without modification, which I did. It was wonderful and well balanced. I'm glad I listened to him. The other pizza we ordered was the Wild Nettles pizza. It was also delicious but I definitely preferred the Bianca above it.
author: Dennis W.

description: The pizza is great. Thin crust with great ingredients. The spaghetti with pancetta was also lovely. The indoor seating is a bit cramped and busy, but the outdoor space is wonderful and so relaxing. Finish your meal with the tiramisu, best I've had in the bay area!
author: R A.

description: Great pizza / Italian restaurant on Divisadero. My dinner-mate and I shared a carafe of wine, arancini, pizza, and panna cotta, and every item was delicious and well-made. I'd place Ragazza in the "excellent place to take a date or visiting family" category, which falls just under the "neighborhood joint I will always hit up if I'm craving that cuisine."
author: Jay M.

description:
So jealous that my brother can walk to this place from home- it is everything I'd want in my dream neighborhood joint. Delish food, great service, reasonable prices. Glad that I was there with my sibs and their +1's because we got to try a lot of the menu.

SALADS
- Baby kale salad with farro, colorful watermelon radish slices, and yummy green goddess dressing- yum!
- Little gem lettuces w/ cukes, purslane (love this rarely scene green), and anchovy dressing (not at all fishy)- winner!

PASTA
- Baked rigatoni w/ eggplant- this takes a while, so be patient. Very good dish to share with perfectly cooked pasta and big chunks of eggplant. 
- Cavatelli w/ lamb, fava beans, mint- another winner. Small serving, but enough for all 6 of us to get a few bites.

PIZZA
- Bianca- this was my FAVE of the night. perfectly crispy/chewy crust topped with onion, garlic, preserved lemon (genius!!), provolone, and arugula. I loved everything about this one.
- Peaches w/ onions, goat cheese, speck, balsamic- also good. Nice sweet/salty balance

DESSERT
- Tiramisu- have to admit, it was almost as good as my own, generous serving is good to share
- Pot de creme- also very good, but warning... it's rich. Only get this if you have a few friends to share.

Definitely recommend.
author: Ryen B.

description:
My only complaint is that they don't deliver and aren't on any of the apps. I actually came here unintentionally one night and I was not disappointed. The wait for a table is pretty long, so call ahead or just go to a bar and drink before dinner. We waited a bit but then the host made it work at the bar which was still great. Really small restaurant though. 

Started the meal off with beet and burrata appetizer and a glass of wine. The by-the-glass section was really good. But I would just buy a bottle because lets be honest, you never just drink one glass of wine. The app was so good!! The crisps they gave us with the burrata were perfect. 

For dinner we got a margherita pizza with prosciutto. It was so good! This is what I dream about when I want pizza. The crust was perfect! Crispy and definitely home made. Overall everything was amazing. 

I will be coming back to try more of the pizzas for sure! Probably on a random weekday though.
author: Michael P.

description:
Ragazza is a definitely a great choice for pizza! A couple of comments:

-It's relatively expensive. My friend and I shared 2 pies and paid around $20 each. Definitely more than I would pay for pizza. 
-The pies are a decent size. One is a bit much for one person so I would suggest sharing one pie and a salad.
-The mushroom pizza tasted very cheesy. I'm a fan of more sauce than cheese, so I didn't enjoy this one as much as the margherita pizza. Also, the pesto combination with the mushrooms was weird tasting. I love mushroom pizza but won't get this one again if I go back.
-The margherita pizza is delicious. 
-The waiters were very nice and quick! 

I'll definitely come back to try some other pies.
author: Remy B.

description:
My friend and I came for dinner here on a Wednesday night and were pretty happy with our meal. We didn't have to wait at all which, from what I read on Yelp, seems to be a constant issue with Ragazza. Our waiter was friendly and our waters were refilled frequently. We decided to split 2 pizzas so we didn't try any of their appetizers or have any wine. We had:

-Margherita ($14): This was great and definitely our favorite. One of the better Margherita pizzas that I have had in SF and it wasn't too heavy.

-Magic Mushroom ($17): This was a bit funky and earthy for us. Points for creativity but this was a bit heavy. I don't think either of us would order this again.

Overall, I thought 2 pizzas was the right amount for 2 people but I could see splitting one and an appetizer if you weren't too hungry. We had 1 leftover slice (my friend's hehe) but I even had to struggle to eat my portion of the pizza a bit. I don't think the price was too bad for thin-crust, upscale pizza but I do think there are a lot of places in the city that do this as well as Ragazza. Overall, I am pretty excited that we are getting a restaurant with the same owner as Ragazza/Gialina in Noe Valley and I am sure I will go. I definitely do see what others are saying that it isn't worth the wait and I think if I had waited longer than 20 minutes and eaten the pizza we had, I would be mad.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Good food with mediocre service. Would give it another try.

By the numbers:
Food 5/5
Ambiance 4/5
Service 3/5
Value 4/5

Warm olive appetizer: Very good
Fried squash blossoms with purslane: Very good
Meatballs: Very good
Wild nettles and prosciutto pizza: Excellent

Notes on service:
For a dining area that seats 38 people and with three servers running the floor, I could not believe how inefficient and inattentive our server was. Our empty water bottle was not replaced when our pizza arrived (took 15mins and a concerted effort to get the waiter's attention). We sat for 20 minutes after finishing eating before the server came over and asked about dessert. Tables around us emptied out and sat uncleared for 10+ mins. Meanwhile, a dozen people are waiting outside in a cold SF summer/winter day to be seated. Boggles the mind.

On the positive side, we were able to walk in at 645p on a Sunday evening and get a table right away, and once we ordered, our appetizers arrived. quickly.
author: Navi O.

description: This pizza place offers a very unique patio seating in a garden at the back. It is gorgeous to dine within the plants and it's like a secret garden in the city. The pizza selection is reasonable with seasonal offerings as well as the classic Margherita. The pancetta one with the egg was kind of salty but the other ones were good. It is pretty overpriced but some people think it's worth it for the ambiance. The Margherita was the best in my opinion because it was simple but the ingredients really shine. The crust is chewy and ultra thin, and the sauce taste fresh and vibrant. However, I'd advise to eat it quickly because it is a thin pizza and it will get soggy if left out for too long. The portion is similar to Blaze Pizza and pieology, but the crust is significantly better.
author: Ellen G.

description:
This is scandalous ,
It's 9:15 we walked down from our home to grab a quick dinner and the place is half packed up and we have been refused at the door saying the closed the kitchen without any notice on the web ..
Too bad I used to like to come to that place 
This was my last trip .
author: Stephane M.

description: What an excellent surprise! We got a Bianca pizza to go and more than surpassed my expectations. It had some interesting topics which complimented the crust really well. Will be back for sure
author: Ilya K.

description:
I have been to Ragazza twice now and have been blown away! The first time we went and got the burrata appetizer, had the server recommend a light, fresh pizza, and a bottle of wine, and it was the most delicious dinner. My girlfriend has been raving about it ever since. 

Fast forward to the second visit, I set up a surprise dinner for my girlfriend and reserved the back gazebo for her and all of her friends. They have a set, 4 course meal menu that was absolutely fantastic and included a lentil and mozzarella salad, warm olives, a kale and green goddess salad, three types of pizza, and tiramisu for desert. Everyone in the group was raving about each course. 

On top of the delicious meal, the staff made the experience unforgettable. I accidentally confirmed dinner for 15 people even though I had reserved the space to fit up to 22, and there were 22 guests in total. When I arrived with her for the surprise, the staff discreetly addressed the issue with me, but told me they would make it work and still helped nail the surprise. They seemed as excited to make the night great for her as we were, and it really made the entire night so much better. They even were able to provide separate options for one guest who was gluten free.

Overall between the food and the friendly staff, Ragazza has become one of my favorite spots in the city. Go there right now.
author: Jackson S.

description:
Ragazza is a solid choice for excellent pizzas and pastas.

The location is so nondescript you probably have passed it a zillion times...but look for it and you will be nicely rewarded with a comfortable ambiance, wonderful service, and fine food.

The six of us ordered a slew of items: two pies, a salumi platter, the arancini balls, lamb meatballs, the rigatoni and two desserts.

Everyone loved the wild nettle pie: It sounds weird but had amazing flavor and texture. The crisp pancetta vs the soft nettles was a great contrast both texturally and taste wise. I wish we had ordered an egg on it! 

The magic mushroom was okay but lacked texture and flavor and was just okay. I would skip.

The  Fried Arancini w/ smoked mozzarella & spicy tomato sauce were great. Crispy outside warm cheese on the inside...these are a must to order.

The Lamb & Pork Meatballs w/ Greek yogurt & pistachio salsa verde were good..but what made the dish was the pistachi salsa verde...that was great. I would definitely order this again.

Pricey but tasty was the Italian picnic...basically a sausage fest (ha ha). It was good, and all the various items were delicious and unique but it is not a lot of food for $18. Maybe on this one.

The last main was the Baked Rigatoni w/ butternut squash,  and fontina béchamel. This was as decadent as a pasta dish can get. Rich velvety rich bechamel. The pasta was cooked perfectly and we were knocked out by the butternut squash. Get it it's good !!!!

Desserts were also great. Both the tiramisu and the pot de creme were well executed.

6 People with drinks and tip $190...not bad. Wasn't a ton of food but it was very good food. Excellent service. Wonderful ambiance in the garden. Inside looks great too!

I would come back in a heartbeat.

Parking tip: Park in the lot next to Nopalito...beats street parking!!!!!
author: David G.

description:
Went to eat at this restaurant based on the reviews and the proximity to my hotel there were approximately 4 to 5 tables open when I went there at 6:30 last Saturday night. a very rude host greeted me (if you want to call him that) at the door and immediately told me that for two people it was at least an hour wait. As I walked away I saw two gentlemen who were greeted much for graciously and when they asked for a table for two the host exuberantly said yes I have one right here!!! the guest said out loud, wow we're shocked we could get a table this quickly without reservations!!!!

I have enjoyed upscale dining for over three decades and have never had this kind of prejudice exacted against me please do not honor this kind of behavior avoid this restaurant
author: Kk S.

description:
Is it just me or does Divisadero St has a million freakin pizza spots?! Ragazza definitely caught our eye as we were walking around looking for some food. We walked in and were greeted with smiles and friendly, warm energy. 

Heirloom Tomato w/ applewood smoked bacon, mozzarella, pistachio pesto, and argula. Absolutely delicious. Would highly recommend! 

Villager- SF Style India Pale Ale: A good light IPA. A little on the stronger side for me but pairs well with pizza. 

Unfortunately, my friend and I were stuffed after sharing a pizza so we didn't try other items. But everything on the menu looked pretty tasty! :)
author: Asia P.

description: There's a wait and be prepared to brace to cold while doing so. The food is absolutely delicious though. Tight space but it's all apart of the ambulance. It doesn't get loud so you can still have intimate conversations.
author: Carol T.

description: Pizza!!!! Lol I love thin crust pizza its my weakness..if your in the area definitely stop in for good thin crust pizza and wine, the restaurant itself is small so plan to come early
author: jonathan h.

description:
This lesbian-owned restaurant is by far one of *the* best dining experiences I have had in The City. 

Now as a trans-woman my motivation for dining here wasn't because it is owned by a member of the LGBT family, but a friend of mine had gotten hired here and I wanted to harass her.. 

I absolutely love the pizza choices we had which were the AMATRICIANA and THE ITALIAN HERO. 

Our salads were the LITTLE GEM LETTUCES w/  Medjool Dates, kumquats, etc.  We also got the BROCCOLI DO CICCIO w/ preserved lemon and white anchovies. So delicious!

Located in the NOPA-Divisadero Court area of The City,  I love this family owned eatery. It is cute, fun, and extremely diverse in it's staff. As a trans-woman in a city that doesn't have as much trans-visibility as I'd like (due to the amount of money it takes to live here!), I felt very much at home in this restaurant!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Solid Food. Terse Service. 

My wife and a few friends stopped by Ragazza a little while ago looking forward to some rustic and tasty Italian food in a mellow environment. We went early. (Don't judge. We like to eat early during the week). Overall the food and drink were solid. We liked our appetizers and entrees. And with a little trial and error, we found an Italian red we could all agree on. Unfortunately, the most memorable aspects of our meal was the abruptness of our server and the wall of sound generated by our fellow diners and us. I can't remember the last time I was at a restaurant where we constantly were asking each other to "What did you say" or commenting on the noise. 

As for our server, either A. he was in a bad mood or B. Ragazza fancies itself an "in and out experience." 

Was our server efficient? Yes. 

Did we feel welcome? No. 

This is disappointing as it sure seems like Ragazza has a lot going for it. A quaint location in a cozy part of N.O.P.A. that is way more accessible then other great restaurants in the area. But if every server is as terse as the one we had, we will think twice about dining there again.
author: Victor H.

description: Was super excited to try this place and so glad the staff was amazing at suggesting options! Best pizza I had in awhile, the crust is amazing all on its own!!
author: Christie V.

description:
Ragazza was already popular and crowded long before the Diviz corridor gentrified rapidly with the arrival of Bi Rite, The Mill, and other places - and it's even more popular these days. 

Whether you're going for antipasti, salads, or the thin-crust pizza, you won't go wrong. It's a good place for small groups, and all the offerings we tried here were spot-on. Service is also friendly and explanatory as well. 

With everything else that's abuzz along Diviz these days, it almost makes me wish I'd rented or bought a place here when I first moved to the Bay Area years ago.
author: Vincent L.

description: GLUTEN FREE review.....the salad was good but the gluten free pizza not so great:(. The crust was extremely thin, no flavor, and soggy. Everyone else I was with enjoyed the regular pizza which is why I give it 3 stars.
author: Lacey W.

description: Amazing pizza and everything else! Great decor, friendly service. I've been here quite a few times at this point. I've never been disappointed.
author: Ryan B.

description: Terrible.  2 hour wait.  Told us it would be 30 mins.  Checked in regularly and they couldn't care less.  They're busy and that's all they care about.  Worst restaurant experience I've had in a very long time and I don't leave bad reviews.
author: Josh W.

description:
I've come here twice with groups of 8, which is perfect because they take reservation and you get to seat outside under a heated tent.

For big groups you have to get the prix fixe menu which has olives, arancini, 2 different salads, 3 types of pizza and dessert!

I'm not really into olives but they come warm and my friends really like this about them.
The arancinis are amazing, they are in a spicy tomato sauce and I could eat this only. 
The salads we had were mozzarella salad and a kale salad. I love the mozzarella salad, the vinaigrette is delicious, it's crunchy, feels fresh yet tasty. I didn't like the kale salad as much, I thought that the dressing was overpowering and I wished I could taste the kale, radishes and avocados better. But it was a great hit among my friends so... :)
The pizza we got were margherita, bianca and one with sausage. The Bianca is my favorite, it has lemon preserve and is topped with lettuce/arugula/green leaves of some sort. It's something I haven't seen anywhere else, it's great. I'm not a huge fan of their pizza to be honest, the dough is good but nothing I crave, it was kind of burned in some spots.
The tiramisu was great! Simple but perfect to end a great meal.
author: Coralie S.

description: A neighborhood staple for mid-scale pizza and wine, Ragazza's vibes cater toward friends having lively conversations. The wine selection is vast yet simple; the pizzas creative yet subtlety rich; and the tables are small and intimate. Great for a fourth or fifth date where you want to hear your dinner partner's life story, or for friends and family catching up. Share the squash pizza with a glass of house white or red!
author: Regina D.

description: The gentleman behind the register tonight(with the Octpus tattoo) was f***ing delightful when we were picking up our pizza. Your service was excilantro. Cheers. -Jimmy and Lynn
author: Jimmy M.

description: Best pizza I've had in SF by FAR. If you like thin crust, crispy pizza, then Ragazza is for you. Also, our waiter was phenomenal. He provided a great wine recommendation and great service. We ordered the little gem salad, amatriciana pizza, and chocolate pot de creme for dessert. All 5 stars. Will definitely be coming back to this adorable neighborhood gem.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I usually don't eat pizza on vacation because I'm from NY and always find myself disappointed. I'm glad I took the suggestion from my aunt to give this place a shot.

We had the burrata to start which was wonderful. The figs were a perfect compliment with their dressings. We opted for the classic margherita and it was delicious. Thin crispy crust, sweet but robust sauce, fresh salty cheese.

I was impressed! But minus one star because nothing beats NY pizza
author: Chris N.

description: I love this place, they have amazing pizzas and pastas here. Their wait staff is extremely friendly and it's hands down the best place for Italian food within the Lower Haight/Divisadero/Upper Haight area. Yes, it's a little pricey, but for what you get, I highly recommend it. We started with the buffata, which that alone was a great gooey starter. We also got the stuffed rice balls (arancini), which on a cold San Francisco night, this was highly needed. Their cavatelli is perfectly made, not too heavy and not falling apart and their panna cotta was divine. Ideally go in the middle of the week, when parking is hopefully not as bad.
author: Carolina S.

description:
We went to Ragazza previously and there was a 30mintues wait. Hence, we left and tried another restaurant. 
On our last meal in San Francisco we decided to return early to give it a try. Our decision to go back was the right choice of the day. 
The deco of the restaurant was full of family photos. Which I reckon it is the owner's family photos. 
They serve pies and pasta. When I saw pie in the menu I thought it was a pie as in pastry covered with fillings inside. The pie in this particular restaurant is a pizza. We ordered the Pies - Amatriciana w/ tomato, Olli pancetta, Calabrian chilies, pecorino, oregano & an organic egg. The pie's crust was amazingly crunchy yet soft and chewy inside. The flavours of the pie is dimensional. Every layer that you chew through the taste was flavourful. 
Antipasti we ordered was Local Asparagus w/ Greek yogurt, black tahini, hardboiled egg & chili oil. Both the dishes that we had was amazing! If I am back in San Francisco again. I will return to try their pizza.
author: Melissa K.

description: The ambiance at this restaurant is absolutely incredible--a prime time first date spot if I do say so myself. I recommend the kale salad. The prosciutto pizza was also pretty yummy! The service made everything so much better.
author: Edson M.

description: Always love this place. Such a great neighborhood gem! The pizzas are perfectly thin. Goddess salad is fresh and flavorful. Really nice wine selections.
author: Sonya S.

description:

author: Dan B.

description: Really enjoyed the pizza I got! Chorizo was definitely spicy! All of the appetizers were amazing as well - we got the baby kale salad, lamb meatballs and the roasted cauliflower. Pretty large potions of the appetizers; sufficient enough that we shared with 6 people! Only gave 4 stars because I was hoping they would have more than 1 option for a pasta dish. Would definitely return. Staff was very nice. And enjoyed that they offer wine in carafes!
author: Daniella J.

description:
If you're looking for a Italian dishes or pizza that's the place. I felt myself in Europe. Charming place with a lovely back garden. My wife and me had olives as start, a tradicional Margarita Pizza, Side of prosciutto, tiramisu and kind of chocolate mousse. Everything was so good but they could add a little more cheese. 
I thought a little expensive $4 for 4 Slides of prosciutto but that's okay because for me because Italian Pizza has to have prosciutto..
author: Allan F.

description:
Went to this restaurant as a recommendation. Very small restaurant and very quaint, fits about 38 people inside. Place was packed and we got there at 9 o'clock - an hour before they closed. 
Excellent food, from the appetizers, to the pizzas, to dessert. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because even though their pizza and appetizer selection was great their actual pasta dishes are very limited. 3 to be exact. We were looking for more pasta choices.
author: Diana E.

description:
First, Greg who I think is the manager is a hoot and a great first impression to the restaurant. He seriously made our night. From his banter welcoming us to the restaurant and then helping us decide on our wine, he made for a great start to the evening. 

Our wine was delicious, he let us try a few things to land on what we wanted. We had to wait about 20-25 mins for a table, but we got to sit in this really adorable, lush garden courtyard area in the back. Super cute and inviting. A perfect place to hang out and probably a great spot for a small event/intimate dinner with a group a friends. 

Then our food was delicious. The arancini, cavatelli, and burrata were all home runs to start. We got two pizzas, the moto and then a white one with lots of arugula and figs that were to die for. Really delicious start to finish. I would definitely venture back when I'm in the SF area again.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Friends brought me here while I was visiting from out-of-town. Kind service. Delicious pizza. We tried the Kale Mary and Putanesca pizzas. The Putanesca owned up to its intentions, delivering all the flavor one would hope for from a Putanesca, but without overpowering the senses and taking away from blissfully encountering the perfectly crafted crust: thinnest in the middle, crispest around the edges, and flavorful enough to taste, even through the rush of Putanesca induced emotions flooding the gates of thine palate. The Kale Mary paired very well with the Putanesca, in the same way that a right-hand glove pairs very well with a left-hand glove. That is to say, awesome irony of their names aside: they were clearly meant for each other! "Tangy" might be the best word to describe the Kale Mary, which, in our case, flirted with the Putanesca's aggressions by way of dancing upon our lips with the smooth and focused assertiveness of a pizza that just so totally wants to be your boss. LET THIS PIZZA TAKE YOU!!! 

Next visit will definitely include trying the Moto and the Bianca.
author: L P.

description:
If you check out my other reviews you will see that, unlike a lot of yelpers, I do not give grades easily.

Ragazza is a winner in every regard.

The guys running this place pay attention to detail.

From the décor, wine list, visible kitchen, pizza, pasta, vegetables, everything is on point.

I had the amatriciana pizza and enjoyed it thoroughly.

I could possibly eat here every night and not get tired of it.
author: Paul N.

description: The best kale-farro salad ever with lots of creamy avocado chunks. Super satisfying and gluten-free. Our server Tink was so gracious and was the perfect blend of attentive but not hovering. The pizza is beautiful as well.
author: Claire G.

description: This hidden Gem of a restaurant is amazing!!! Picture is the Moto pie with an added egg. This pizza would make me want to come back every week. Great recommendations from the waiter, who were all amazing. My husband doesn't like blue or goat cheese based off the smell but he was open and we ordered the arugula salad with strawberries and he was in heaven. Totally changed his mind about goat cheese. If a restaurant can change someone's mind about things they thought they didn't like before, it is definitely a winner!
author: Cindy M.

description: Delicious food, comfortable atmosphere, and attentive staff. Bianca pizza is delicious.
author: Laura R.

description: I Love this place!!!! Great food and amazing service from everyone in their team !!! Los Amo!
author: einstein A p.

description:
Looking to try something new and feeling in the mood for pizza, we took the bus over to lower haight to try out Ragazza. This place made a few appearances on the 7x7 list so we went in with high expectations. Getting there a bit early on a Sunday afternoon we were lucky enough to get the last open table.

Arancini - 2/5 - Decent arancini. The pesto got drowned out in the sauce by the tomato flavor. 
Mozzerella, Prosciutto & Crackerbread - 3/5 - Tasty dish with a generous serving of mozzerella and crackerbread although not quite enough prosciutto to pair up with.
Pizza - 4/5 - What stood out the most to me was how thin and crispy the crust of this pizza was, which I enjoyed. We started with a margherita and added pancetta, garlic, mushrooms and an egg to it. While this was a quality pizza, I don't think it earns a spot as a top pizza option in SF.

Overall, I had a decent experience at Ragazza. It wasn't exceptional and I don't think I will be returning, but I will say that it was "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: Not to bad of a place, right next to the hotel we stayed at. The pizza offerings were great combinations. The crust was a little too crispy for my liking, and the price was a little higher than I would want to pay, but it is all good
author: Genyl B.

description: First of all I'm from New Jersey so I think I should have a little pull with my feedback.   I love it when I stumble onto a hidden gem and this place is one of them!  It's cozy, friendly and the locals are seated so that was the first clue I was in the right place.  The food is creative and delicious with a flair.  All of the staff, and I mean all of them, were extremely friendly! Let's put it this way, If I lived here I'd give it 2 stars so I'd have the place to myself!
author: Michael R.

description:
My room mate suggested this place and went to this restaurant for dinner. Amazing food, very friendly service. The highlighting moment was the dessert. Oh, the Nutella pizza with mascarpone was just out of the world !!! Loved it!!
I liked the restaurant vibe as well. Not too commercial. Nice cozy place and felt good. Definitely would go again. Bookmarked already :)
author: Dinesh C.

description: THE CARBONARA OF ALL  PIZZAS  (Try the Amatriciano if you want something different) Thin crust, it's light and wonderful pancetta laced with some nice oil and parmigiana. Delish
author: Jerry L.

description:
Delicious pizza!! 
The pizza is thin and on the wet side (some people might not like), but the crust is really good, and still good after two days in the fridge! Pizza is not super cheesy either so you won't feel it's too rich or heavy. You can add things like egg, anchovy, etc to any pizza, too. 
Space is nice and comfortable, more comfortable than their other restaurant Gialina. Staff is super friendly and nice too. Came here on a Tuesday night and the restaurant filled up quickly after 7:30pm. 
Parking can be a not challenging so allow some time to find parking!
author: Iris H.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a recommendation for a date night last night! It's really cute - kinda small and stuffy inside but there's a cute heated gazebo outside that's better for chatting.

We shared the Lamb & Pork Meatballs w/ yogurt which was really good! Came with 6 - perfect for splitting. It had a mediterranean taste with the yogurt sauce. 

We both ordered the House Made Ricotta Cavatelli w/ walnut pesto, wild arugula & Parmigiano. I asked if I could add in meat because I saw the option at the bottom of the page to add onto pizzas, but alas they would not let me. Italian places always deny my request to switch things up! However, I ended up loving it without the additional protein. It was the perfect serving size. I ate the whole thing and didn't feel overly full. 

The big mystery is that my boyfriend got food poisoning :( We ordered the same thing and I felt fine but for him it was pretty immediate - maybe an hour after we finished he went running to the bathroom. He hadn't eaten anything else that day since breakfast so we really didn't think it could be anything else. Bummer because the food was so good!
author: Kelly G.

description: This place had some of the best pizza I've had in a while!! We got the Bianca, which had an onion base. As someone who doesn't loooove tomato sauce, this was such a delicious option. We also had the baby kale said, which was perfect in combo with the pizza. Will definitely be back soon!
author: Shannon L.

description: I just had my 30th birthday dinner in Ragazza's outdoor, heated gazebo and it could not have been more perfect (so much so that I'm writing my first yelp review in years). Leading up to the dinner, Greg was extremely responsive and helpful with all the planning.  The service was impeccable, every single dish was absolutely delicious, and finally, the ambiance was out of a fairy tail. Truly everything was beyond expectations.
author: Camila T.

description:
There are so many amazing pizza places in San Francisco that I couldn't give this one 5 stars but it is still good. They have a good selection of wines by the glass. 
If you are sitting in the back patio tent just be aware that it gets very loud.
author: Sam A.

description: Last minute decision and don't regret changing from Mexican to Italian, this place is everything!! Hole in the wall and very friendly staff. Five star and more kind of pizza!!
author: Xavi B.

description:
I've heard a lot about this place from friends and co-workers, and even with all the hype, I found this to be a really great spot!

THE SERVICE: Twink was so cute! We all loved her - she was really funny and sweet, and gave good, honest recommendations on the food. 

THE WAIT: Our friends put our name down at ~6pm, we were eating by 7:10pm (our table was actually ready a little earlier but we weren't). You can actually call in to put your name down as well.

MUST-HAVES: Fried Arancini (antipasti), Cavatelli (pasta), Nutella pizza.

ANTIPASTI: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig
* Fried Arancini w/ sundried tomato pesto ($9) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#7Vn9Im00Qa82xDGn4erCEA
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#907wdsTwU-ctEctDeoR9bw
This had amazing texture! The outside was very crisp, and the inside was soft and creamy with the melted cheese. The tomato added a very sharp flavor as well.

* Kale & Little Gem Lettuces w/ beets, farro, avocado, radish & green goddess dressing ($10 size) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#DwQlduOJ7r-d6Bjdj2g5kA
This had a good mixture of textures with the thick, grainy farro and fairly heavy dressing. I thought the kale could be more crisp though, and overall there could be a little more flavor (the dressing was a little bland). 

* Hand Pulled Mozzarella w/ honeydew melon, purslane, Prosciutto di Parma & cracker bread ($14) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#l9AQdiOjoiq3ygzpdMVjjg
The mozzarella was very soft and fresh. The honeydew was a little out of place. The purslane was really interesting - we were all wondering what it was and had to look back at the menu. The crackers were very crisp but not super crumbly - they were good for breaking into bite-sized pieces to eat with the cheese.

PASTAS & ROASTS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#cb6YFtZl5mVInRfjmZOizA
* House-Made Cavatelli w/ carbonara sauce, guanciale, English peas & Parmigiano ($17) - 5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#g5yXkQGMahNejs6L0mtW4w
This had a perfect chewy texture, just the right amount of sauce (which was very thick and tasty), and overall we all found this very delicious!

PIES: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#T3XeO5u7v8GZA7OuxccrwA
* Moto - tomato, Calabrian chilies, mushrooms, red onion, sausage & mozzarella ($16) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#pcv04P7u8YhuQaWnfzOx0w
This had a pretty good kick of spiciness to it. The crust was softer than the Amatriciana.

* Amatriciana w/ tomato, Olli pancetta, chilies, pecorino, oregano & an organic egg ($17, plus $2 for the extra egg) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#kYzlN_x2ZmfY4lt1SYNhwA
egg cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#RHHEVgqIdEIbK94EK4BsUQ
This had a more grainy (possibly cornmeal?) crust than the Moto. It was definitely pretty salty! I did like the extra burst of flavor, but my friends thought it was a little much. They didn't do traditional radial slices, but instead cut this into squares. We didn't request this but didn't mind - maybe it was because we had extra eggs, to help us share? Just something to keep in mind in case you're particular about the way your pizza is sliced.

DESSERTS: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#inf6y5smaGZpC0davECO1Q
* Chocolate Pot de Crème ($7) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#cj7_QPyn525CGSbWYnsdng
The whip cream was a little light, but the chocolate itself was dense yet soft & smooth. A little in between dark and milk chocolate flavor-wise. It also had a hint of sea salt, which was really nice.

* Nutella Pizza w/ mascarpone & Amaretti ($9) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=dfd3tN6s6HVylyAzH5y0Ig#NyGCje5GeIIuAIyXkdtA7g
I was surprised that I liked this! I originally nixed the idea of *another* pizza after our two entrees, but this was significantly different. The crust is much thicker and softer, also a bit grainy. It had this amazing fresh bread smell. I really loved it and could have just eaten it as plain bread! We also liked that the nutella was topped with mascarpone, which is a little denser and thicker than whipped cream (which would have started melting and falling apart pretty quickly). The mascarpone added more to the overall texture of the dessert.
author: Ziyan C.

description: One of the best place to get a quality Italian meal in the city.
author: Brad T.

description:
Originally, we were meeting at Brenda's Meat & Three, but I guess none of us were feeling it after all. My friend suggested Ragazza and I am so glad she did! We ended up getting a fig salad appetizer, a pasta and a summer squash pizza with ricotta, hold the pork.

The figs with honey was served with honey and goat cheese - it featured just a few greens and was quite the small portion to share between three people. The pasta was unmemorable, but the pizza was definitely where it was at. The crust was the perfect texture and the toppings were delicious. We all agreed that the pizza was the star. I would definitely come here for the pizza and some of the apps (there was a squash blossom appetizer that looked interesting); skip the pasta. Dessert looked amazing but we decided to go to Bi-Rite instead. We were all comfortable-y full, though we thought at first we may have ordered too little food. Bill ended up about $18 w/tax and tip per person.

I would certainly recommend this place, but be prepared to wait - I think we waited about 30 mins on a Thursday night.
author: Christina K.

description:
This place is really good!

Atmosphere: You can't make reservations, but there was little to no wait when I went. It was pretty crowded and the tables are very close together, but it's okay. The outdoor Gazebo is really cute but you need to have a party of 6 or more to make a reservation.

Food: I heard the Kale salad was amazing so I definitely wanted to try it. My thoughts: It was good and I would eat it again, but it was by no means amazing. I would rate 3/5, just because I was all hyped up and expecting more, so I was slightly disappointed. 

We also got the Cherry Tomatoes w/ Niman Ranch applewood smoked bacon, basil, mozzarella & wild arugula pie (split between 2 people). It was really good. 4.5/5. We even had leftovers. I need to come back and try the pasta, and the margherita pie, so I can compare with other margherita's I've had in SF.

Overall: Good food, small and quaint, down to come again.
author: Jenna G.

description:
I had an exceptional first dining experience at Ragazza and I can't wait to go back. The food was delicious and interesting and Eric and Vanessa were as welcoming, friendly, and attentive as they could be. 

Ragazza is one of those neighborhood gems with amazing cusine that San Francisco is famous for. One of my close friends who grew up in Italy told me Ragazza was one of her favorite places and after listening to her gush I decided to give it a try. Ragazza has a very relaxed atmosphere but also appears very clean and comfortable. I really like open kitchens and you can watch as your food is being prepared.

Their specialty is pizza but they have several other items on the menu. My appetizer was the lamb and pork meatballs served over Greek yogurt and a tasty pistachio salsa verde. The cool and tangy yogurt presented an interesting counterpoint to the warm and spicy meatballs and the pistachio salsa verde gave the entire dish an interesting kick. My entree was a flavorful saffron tagliatelle with chanterelle and maitake mushrooms, espelette-Meyer lemon butter and parmigiano cheese which I enjoyed with a glass of Fattoria Selvapiana chianti. The tagliatelle was delicious and the saffron flavor blended perfectly with the fleshy buttered mushrooms which were likewise cooked just right. I also had a crunchy and tangy side dish of fresh asparagus served on top of a generous dollop of black tahini yogurt and lightly toasted sesame seeds. Of course I wasn't leaving without dessert, and the honey lavender panna cotta with fresh, plump blackberries was perfectly finished with a glass of Quinta De La Rosa ruby port. 

Overall this was a wonderful dining experience and I hope to repeat it soon.
author: Lou S.

description:
My level of Yelp dependence has reached nearly pathological levels, so I have to be pretty desperate, confident or adventurous to step into a restaurant I haven't yelped first. But there we were, stepping out of the comic book store at 6 pm, and there were our children, saying things like "I'm hungry" and "can't we get something to eat?" (Oh, kids....it's always something with you.)

Ragazza looked decent, and it was busy, but not so busy they couldn't seat it. So we took a leap! And miraculously, it paid off. Our melon salad was fantastic, as was the salad of tomatoes in brown butter -- I know it sounds crazy but it was delicious! Our mains (ricotta cavatelli and chicken breast) were good but not extraordinary.

What *was* extraordinary was the pizza. Our daughter, who normally eats like a bird, ate two entire full-sized pizzas! That's because the Ragazza Margherita has hardly any cheese: it's basically a really delicious crust with a layer of fresh tomato sauce. It's ruined our daughter for any other pizza.

I'd love to say that this ushers in a bold new lifestyle in which I try restaurants without Yelping them first, but who am I kidding? What are the odds we'd get this lucky twice?
author: Alexandra S.

description: You must have a reservation. Its a very nice place to eat delicious pizza with side of chili sauce.Definitely we will be there soon.
author: Pinar D.

description: I have been going to Ragazza for years and it is consistently delicious!! I love their Little Gem salad and haven't found a pizza that wasn't amazing. They also have an awesome fixed menu for a party group, which is so fun for birthdays! They put you in the back patio area and feed you a ton of delicious food, all for like $35 per person or something! Definitely one of my favorite pizza spots and restaurants in SF.
author: Danielle M.

description:
Solid Italian place on Divis. I came here with three other people on a Saturday night, and the wait was around 45 minutes. My friend conveniently lives literally around the corner, so it worked out well since we just had to wait for a text from the restaurant saying our table was ready. 

Between the four of us, we ordered two appetizers, three pizzas, and one pasta.

Appetizers: fried arancini & brussels sprouts. The fried arancini (stuffed rice balls) was good because I enjoyed the spicy tomato sauce they came with. The brussels sprouts were a little too soggy in my opinion, but the rest of our group enjoyed them a lot.

The three pizzas we got were: bianca, brussels sprouts, and pear. I think the bianca was the best - the use of lemon in the pizza really brought the whole thing together for me. I also loved the arugula on top and provolone as the cheese. The brussels sprouts pizza sounded a lot better in my mind. There was way too much bacon on top; it was super aggressive. The shaved brussels sprouts and caramelized onions underneath the slightly burnt bacon layer on top was just too much going on. I didn't get a taste of the pear pizza, but my friend enjoyed it a lot, so I will take his word on it. My friend ordered the ricotta cavatelli and said it was very rich. 

I think the best part of the meal was the bianca pizza. It's a pretty good go-to place for Italian food, but I wouldn't say it's super casual or anything since it's more a sit-down meal. Since it's not a super big place, I imagine the wait here can get pretty bad at rush dinner hours.
author: Steph V.

description:
This is the best pizza I have ever tasted!  I'm not a huge pizza fan but I make an exception for wood fired pizzas with a thin crust.  When we were in New York, I learned that I like "New York Style" pizza.  That's what Regazza is.  If you're looking for a thick, doughy pizza, this is not your jam.  But if you want a pizza where you hesitate between using a fork or folding it in half, this is it.  But beyond that, I don't know what these people put in their sauce, but it is amazing!  It's almost like it's blended with ricotta cheese.  We ordered the Margherita and it was perfect.  Just enough basil and tomato.  Now I'm looking forward to coming back to try the other pies.  They also have a pretty complete wine selection which I plan on checking out on our next visit.

The staff was very friendly and efficient.  We saw a group of 5 have to wait for about 5 minutes but we were a group of two and we got in, got served, ate and paid pretty quickly all told.  The atmosphere is very comfortable inside (I learned about the gazebo outside as we were leaving) and we definitely could have lingered but we had other plans for the evening.
author: Stacy S.

description: Still a neighborhood gem after all these years. Service is excellent. Food is superb. Ambiance is cozy. I usually do take out. My favorites are the amitriciana and the kale salad. I dabble in the seasonal pies as well and all have been excellent. What would I do without Ragazza??
author: Katherine B.

description: My Best friend and I came in on a weeknight and had a FANTASTIC dinner! Our server was Eric, and he was great- he walked us through the wines, and helped us order a most amazing feast. We ordered a little of everything from each category on the menu and shared everything. We loved the pasta that we got and the salad was perfect. The roast chicken was fantastic. We ended up ordering so many things that we both had lunch the next day, which was also delicious. The service was excellent, and we had a wonderful evening. We will be back!
author: London E.

description:
Great food, ambience and service. The lamb and pork meatballs were fantastic and a perfect dish to share to start. The baked rigatoni was full of flavor and the pizza was just perfect. 

Stuffed and happy. That's what she said...
author: Victoria P.

description: The wait was long but well worth it. We put our name in and the host recommended some nearby bars to grab a drink while we waited. We ordered a carafe of the Falanghina, really great wine! Our server seemed very knowledgeable about the menu. The starters were pretty good but the pizza is where is at! We went for the Moto: sausage, calabrian chilies, portobello mushrooms, and red onions. So good!
author: Thomas R.

description:
Extremely impressed!!! We threw my best friend's 30th birthday there last night.  Carlos was our server and his attention to detail was on point!  We had a preset menu because it was such a large party (which I am normally skeptic about) and there was more than enough food and the entire party was impressed with every course!  Carlos boxed all the left overs for us without even asking him to.  Food was amazing, service impeccable, ambiance was adorable! The back patio is perfect for large parties and the pictures turned out so cute!!

5 stars!!! And an extra shout out to Carlos for being the best!!!
author: Katie K.

description:
Looking back at the past few days visiting the city this small Italian neighborhood restaurant was truly one of the highlights. 

Cozy, friendly and a really relaxed atmosphere when you walk in are the first impressions you enjoy at Ragazza. 

Perhaps more importantly they get two things right. Food and service. 

We started with a shared appetizer of lamb meatballs which were sensational. Full of flavor and the perfect amount m to share. Then it was one of the best pizzas I've had in a longtime. Full of natural flavor and perfectly cooked. It was a good size without being crazy and not a problem to finish the whole thing. There are many more delicious entrees on the menu and I was surprised I picked a pizza but so glad I did. I was memorable and I don't say that about pizza outside NYC too often. 

The only reason this isn't w 5 star is because we ordered a lemon and verbena panna cotta to end the meal and there was no lemon flavor at all.  It was nice, just not what we ordered. 

All in all one to remember and we will be back.
author: Guy D.

description: A lovely little experience-   came here on a rainy night.  Nice decor/lighting; the service, although expectedly working hard to serve a full house, was engaged with the food and was happy to answer our questions.  Pasta was good and pizza was above average- they definitely use noticeably high quality ingredients.  I would recommend and I'd would certainly return (and check out that little backyard area in the back).
author: Charles C.

description:
08.25.12 | bookmarked 10.07.10

Amatriciana Pizza. Get it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ragazza-san-francisco?select=b7nlTQ4HNH0BKcvLk9spUA#b7nlTQ4HNH0BKcvLk9spUA

Worth it.
author: Jenny L.

description: We celebrated a friend of ours who is about to get married. Everything was easy, effortless and perfect. We reserved the gazebo, which was heated, gorgeous and semi-private. The menu was set in advance which made ordering for a large group, payment, etc super easy. The food was delicious and every dish impressed. The wine was great and service was superior. This is a great option for groups (and takeout and just a regular dinner) since there's a private space, affordable, delicious, accommodating and just overall a fantastic experience. I highly recommend it and would come back for another event with friends and family.
author: Katie M.

description:
I was super excited to try Ragazza for SF Restaurant Week this year but left feeling disappointed about the underwhelming experience.

My boyfriend and I got here around 8 pm per their advice to avoid the rush (they said they didn't take reservations). We both chose the Restaurant Week menu.

Food: 
The ingredients were good in their freshness but overall bland. 
-The kale salad was aesthetically pleasing but too creamy and slightly blah. It may have been the inclusion of the farro which made it more filling but also more subdued. This could be a main dish in itself (for future reference).
-Hanger steak was served cold and was tougher than it should've been to chew. The gorgonzola on top was a nice touch and made the steak more flavorful. The potatoes were decent but the side of veggies was also cold with SUPER hard pieces of ham.
-Dessert of the chocolate pot de creme was the saving grace and I feel like it was a good move on their end to finish the menu off with this. Light, delicious, and not too sweet. I went back and forth between 3 and 4 stars but feel 4 stars is seriously inflating this menu. 3.5 would be more accurate.

Service:
-Not good. Our waitress was pretty rude and seemed annoyed when coming back to our table to check how things were. Don't ask if you don't care would be my preference.

Atmosphere: 
-Cute spot and I liked the interior. It seemed warm and inviting.

I had to knock off two stars due to the lackluster food and service. I would've expected that both of these would be spot-on during Restaurant Week to attract a more loyal following. Maybe the menu highlighted the wrong dishes? I'll give Ragazza the benefit of the doubt after seeing the other reviews and probably be back to try something else, but there are other restaurants I would prioritize.
author: Salma R.

description: Ragazza is great! Their service is amazing, especially since we brought our son. The food is great! Overall highly recommend
author: Payal M.

description:
Since Ragazza doesn't deliver and I was too lazy to leave the house, I ordered it on Postmates. 

The Amatriaciana (which is apparently what everyone orders) is delicious!  Tomato, Olli pancetta, chilies, pecorino, oregano & an organic egg on top makes it a great pizza.  I love myself a good egg and this one was good addition to a great pizza already. 

Delicious! I'll have to try something in the actual restaurant next time!
author: Nina Y.

description: We got the calamari (it was its menu debut) and the magic mushroom with prosciutto pizzas.  Buonissimo!  My fiance and I argued whether it was the sauce or the crust that made the calamari so wonderful.  I think we were both right.  Both pizzas were a joy to eat.
author: Mirba E.

description:
Was looking for a good Italian restaurant to seat 4 without a wait on a Friday night and we found our winner - Ragazza! Don't know if we just got lucky, but we arrived around 7:30 and were seating right way, I'm definitely not complaining! 

We ordered the Fried Arancini to start. It comes with 3 large-ish balls of fried rice in a spicy red sauce. To say the least, it was delicious! Definitely recommend that to share. For our mains we shared the Ricotta Cavatelli, and the Bianca, and Brussel Sprouts pies. I enjoyed the Cavatelli because it had a citrus-y flavor which was very unique for a pasta dish. Out of the two pizzas, I like the Bianca a little more, although it was pretty heavy and a little more cheesy than I like. The brussel sprouts were a little overwhelming and the pizza had a unique chewy texture that I'm not sure I liked. 

Overall, I would recommend this place because they have such a variety and their food is good! They only take reservations for a group of 6 or more but it didn't look like it gets to crowded based on my experience! The bill came out to $20/person - more than reasonable for some good quality food in SF!
author: Malika R.

description:
I've been there with my boyfriend, + his mom and uncle who're visiting from Italy. 
We loved the dough, it totally reminds us home. We're not used to that amount of toppings in Italy, but I loved the mountain of purslane on my pizza! I haven't been able to finish it, so they gave me the leftovers in a box to enjoy them at home. 
An amazing fact is that they have a cozy and pretty garden behind the restaurant, where you can wait for your table drinking a glass of wine. So cool!
author: Valentina G.

description:
I went last night for the first time with a friend of mine and the food was good, nothing super special but it was a cute spot. However, it's one of those places that they won't sit you until you have "your whole party", but mine was only two people. I had asked to sit in the front of the restaurant and there was another table in the back and the hostess said no problem, until the manager came over and asked how many were in our party and she said 2, and then he said no, sit them back there. 

I am not a very picky person and can usually be flexible, but he spoke about me like I wasn't there and was even rude to hostess. He acted like I was some low level person. No one came over to even bring me water and when I asked about any wine specials I was told "no we don't give discounts", which is not really even what I was asking. It was as though I was some low level person trying to get a deal, and even if I was...it's not a way to treat people.

First and last time there---there are many other pizza places on Divisadero that are A. Better food, B. better service and C. Nicer people
author: Taylor M.

description:
Pros
- Great pizza and great food
- The service is usually pretty good

Cons
- The bar area is really small
- No real waiting area, although they do have a couple of benches outside to sit on while you wait
author: Dipesh G.

description: Loved Ragazza!!!  Nice flavor combinations used on their pizzas, and all done to wood fired perfection! Started with some really fresh baked breads and their fried arancini balls. They were good, but the sauce that came with them was great!!! Had a Margherita & a Bianca pie. Oohh!! that Bianca pie, loved it!!!! Salty and zesty  from the preserved lemons combined with the bitterness of the arugula, mixed with the crema, cheese & garlic!!!! Love, love, loved it!!!! I really want more just thinking of it. All very reasonably priced with good service. GO!!!
author: Karen R.

description:
Decor was super cute-- there's even an outside area to sit in that resembles someone's cozy backyard. Service was very friendly and helpful. Pizza was good, but not the best. We ordered the zucca (ricotta and butternut squash) pizza and the cheese was a bit dry and crumbly, and slices of the squash were just falling off the pizza. Everyone ended up eating a squash salad and pizza crust since the toppings would not stay on the pizza. The focaccia bread was tasty, but the olive oil and vinegar came out in a narrow little tub. Not conducive to dipping if you wanted some vinegar since it sank in a small dot to the bottom while the rest of your bread soaked up and inch and a half of olive oil. Mmmmm oil bread. We also ordered the hand-pulled mozzarella which was decent.

The other pizzas we shared included the Triple P (very tasty) and Moto (also good), but we were warned by the server about how spicy these pizzas were going to be. Turns out? Not spicy at all. There's a slight kick, yes, but not enough to call spicy-- especially by San Franciscan standards. Overall, I expected a bit more flavor for the price. Not a bad place though. Would be cute for dates.
author: Evonne L.

description:
Yum!  

No reservations so you may have to wait, but we were lucky as it was a long weekend and parking was easy and the wait was short.  

Love the vibe and energy and can't believe I've never been before.  The food was delicious.  We ordered the shishito peppers with goat cheese, the chicken liver pate with cherries and flatbread, and the Moto pizza.  That and a glass of wine cost about $54 before tip.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other delicious-sounding pizzas.  Really cute garden area with some tables in the back as well.
author: Vivian W.

description:
It was a friends b-day and we had a group of 5 for dinner. I loved the decor as it had a modern appeal yet old school. Theres photos of italian women and travel posters on the wall. This restaurant is in the haight/panhadle area and me and my friends were trying to figure out what neighborhood we were in for like 20 minutes. 

We were not able to get a table right away, so we were seated in this beautiful patio area in the back of the restaurant. It has really nice glass string lights and park bench seats. We waited out there for about 30-40 minutes due to how busy it was. We were given a free glass of Prosecco for waiting. 

Once we were seated we choose the Lacinato Kale salad which was delicious! It was a mix of kale, avocado, farro, and radish. We ordered the large portion and shared it with the table. We also ordered the Moto pizza which has tomato, Calabrian chilies, portobello mushrooms, red onion, sweet Italian sausage and mozzarella. This pizza had a little kick and lot of flavor it was really good. One of the best pizzas I've had in awhile. We also ordered the Bianca pizza which has onion crema, shaved garlic, preserved lemon, aged provolone and wild arugula. Although the pizza came with mixed greens instead of arugula. It was really good, it has a really savory taste and although it was a vegetarian pizza it felt like it was filling and hearty. I've never had a pizza like this one and it was extremely good. 

I'd definitely return back to this restaurant. Great ambiance, great food, and the staff was very kind.
author: Ebonie M.

description:
i loved gialina so this was no different.

Amatriciana w/ tomato, Olli pancetta, chilies, pecorino, oregano, organic egg was really delish.  so was the beet salad with avo, pine nuts and goat cheese. we also had a really yummy fish tartare. the pot de creme was a good end to a fab meal!
author: she q.

description:
Sharon Ardiana does it again. First at Gialina, now Ragazza...?!

At least she has now given me a new reason to explore another neighborhood in San Francisco. And it's really only sprinkles on top that Bi-Rite Divisadero is just down the street...it's like a glutton's dream.

I tried the "Miss Figgy" pizza and found it very delicious. The sweetness of the figs was balanced out nicely by the salt from the prosciutto and the bitter bite from the arugula. My friends ordered the potato pizza and the summer squash. The potato pizza was immediately polished off by my friend who raved about potato pizzas in general, but my friend who ordered the summer squash felt that there was just way too much cheese. 

I do love the fact that Ragazza has a outdoor covered patio...we got to sit outside on a warm San Francisco evening, loved the ambiance...but service was kind of lacking out here.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
We definitely like coming here (been here more times than I can count). Pizzas are consistently great, and the salads are usually worth the trip alone.

Lately we've gone early on a weekday (like Tuesday) and it's been quick to get seated and served. This week, even with that strategy, was quite busy and we had to wait a good 20 minutes. The place was crowded - every table full. A bit loud, even with their sound-buffers on the ceiling.

The food:
Almost always get the kale/farro salad, with green goddess dressing (ordered lite). It was good but not exceptional. Heavy on the radish, and the kale seemed a bit tougher than usual with lots of stems.  

We got the moto pie, recommended by the server as the top choice for a meat-pizza. Added an egg, which I ordered on the done side (I don't like the white part runny) - executed perfectly. Sausage was fine to taste - could be chopped into smaller pieces & spread around the pizza a bit more.

I think the level of busy delayed our pizza a little. Understandable. Overall, a decent experience on this visit. Nothing stood out as stellar, but food/service all as expected.

I know it's the big-expensive-City, but it'd be nice to have a few "house-wine" options that are under $10/glass. B/C no matter what, a "pizza and salad" night out ends up topping the 100$ mark. And it's great there, but 100 seems like a lot for pizza, salad and wine.
author: A S.

description:
Disappointing. Yelp has let me down. Was expecting a delicious meal based on reviews and received one that left me saying "Meh" at the end of it.

Pizza from Delfina, Flour+Water and Tony's Pizza Napoletana kills Ragazza's. With so much amazing food in SF, it'll be easy to never return here.

What we ordered:
- Wild Arugula salad w/ white peaches, goat cheese & pistachios
- Fresh Hand Pulled Marinated Mozzarella salad w/ farro, corn, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes & purslane
- Moto pizza - tomato, Calabrian chilies, mushrooms, red onion, sausage & mozzarella

Good:
- Wild Arugula salad - Husband devoured it, said it was great. But then he said "These flavors are nothing new, I feel like I could get this at Cheesecake Factory!" (yikes) He would order it again, but it was not an inventive dish you'd make a beeline to Ragazza for. 

Meh: 
- Moto pizza - While the toppings worked well together with a nice kick of heat, the crust left something to be desired. Soggy in the middle with overly dry crusts, did not have a good chew. The crust needed more salt in its dough; it was bland and wasn't satisfying.

Bad:
- Fresh Hand Pulled Marinated Mozzarella salad - WTF were they thinking with this? Hot mess. The three massive mozzarella balls were tough and purslane did not work well with the rest of the flavors. Also, this dish was huge, I wish our server mentioned that two salads were way too much for two (non-obese) people. This salad alone would've been enough for 2-4 adults.

Ambiance:
WHAT? I CAN'T HEAR YOU! Our table was in the middle of two other tables, each about 6" away on each side. That definitely put a damper on the meal. I heard our neighbors more clearly than my husband. 

Service:
Service was acceptable/uneventful until the end, just before we stood up to leave. A server was cleaning up the table next to us and spilled a glass of water. It splashed over the entire table and all over my husband. The server was more concerned about the water on himself and did not notice AT ALL that water was also on my husband. Even while my husband sat there drying himself off with the napkin, no staffers noticed since they'd since walked away. Not a good note to end a mediocre meal on.
author: Jen P.

description:
Color me unimpressed. I'd like to love this place, since it's so close to my apartment, but nothing stood out, the prices are pretty high, and the margarita pizza was bad.

This might be a great California "let's put pork belly and an organic egg on something and people will come here no matter what" place... but I'm not sold.
author: Jake D.

description:
There are many things to like about Ragazza, but food is not one of them.
Went here with my boo and cuzzos on a busy Saturday night. 
It's a great neighborhood spot, friendly service, good menu choices, short wait time.

Food:
Haricot verts starter- overcooked, anchovies and zest all unmarried 
Bucatini uni butter- overcooked pasta, too rich with huge, whole, sundried tomatoes- Is it 1991?
Pizzas: Great concept pies and don't get me wrong- I like crispy things- but these pies were overcooked.
Margarita had a good marriage of cheese and sauce but was way too salty and had a "sat out for a while under a heat lamp" vibe. Monotone and lacked brightness that you normally get from the tomato.
Bianca reminiscent of cheeseboard/arizmendi flavor and juiciness- but too greasy and recongealed cheesey.

Even though I enjoyed my dinner- this is not a place I would return. Seems like a good option if you're in the neighborhood and in a pinch.
author: Hallie C.

description: Stop reading and go have the Moto, it's epic.  Rest of the pizzas are legit if not outstanding.  Props to the Nutella dessert pizza, quite good as well.  Nice vibe in this joint too.  Well done, West Add, well done.
author: Saminda W.

description: Incredible!  Food was amazing but most of all, Greg made the experience unforgettable. Very professional yet personal. If you're looking for great food and great service, this is the place to be!
author: Melissa C.

description: Pizza was good when I eat there but don't ever get it takeout. Dominos which I haven't had since college way better. Sad.
author: Matthew H.

description:
+ : the friendliness of the staff, the big pies (/pizzas) very tasty!
- : lack of privacy (tables were very close to each other), a little bit disappointed with the homemade pasta (small portion and lack of flavor even though the vegetables were perfectly cooked!)

I would definitely go back and try the rest of the menu!
author: Stéphanie G.

description:
The best pizza place I know in the city. Can takeout or eat in. Always busy but never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table.
Unlike most pizza around here this one actually tastes great.
author: Kate H.

description:
ONE OF THE "BEST" PIZZAS IN SF. BAD, BAD, BAD ATTITUDE.

Let me preface by saying, this would be a 5 STAR review if it weren't for our waitress, Grace's BAD attitude and BIZARRE behavior. Her behavior was so disconcerting that I decided to skip 6 reviews just to write this one. But, more on that later.

On Sunday, 10.30.11, my friends and I came to Ragazza at 7 pm for dinner. There are NO reservations and the wait was about 45 minutes. I highly recommend coming on the weekdays instead where there's little to no wait.

F O O D
*SPECK w/ Stracciatella, Cubanelle Peppers & Housemade Breadsticks ($12) - 4 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9acPdpguULGPbChPwpS3aw?select=AhYYQwHw2wwGfRe4jJ1veg
The warm doughy breadsticks was served with salty prosciutto, creamy and milky burrata-type cheese and crisp sweet tangy peppers. Salty, savory and creamy goodness with a touch of sweetness.

*PIZZAS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9acPdpguULGPbChPwpS3aw?select=G1pXjZAfjbaNHlsPRWYtOw
The crust is the quintessential part of a pizza and Ragazza has that down to a "T". The pizza crust was flawlessly baked with a slightly charred (not burnt like some places) and blistered outer crust that produced a satisfying light, crackling crispness. The crust was crisp throughout which many other restaurants have a hard time perfecting. 

**MOTO w/ Tomato, Calabrian Chilies, Mushrooms & Sausage ($16) - 5 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9acPdpguULGPbChPwpS3aw?select=XskAnx-wn782bRxKWP2vKw
Our fav of the night, the Moto had a PERFECT balance of tanginess from the tomato sauce, rich savoryness from the sausage, and earthiness from the mushrooms with a slight kick from the chilies.

**AMATRICIANA w/ Boccalone Pancetta, Chilies, Pecorino & Farm Egg ($16 +$2 for each add'l egg) - 4 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9acPdpguULGPbChPwpS3aw?select=3_MdSe9c00rPZhDKx7h2zA
With a less hearty meatiness, the Amatriciana was a close second with the runny egg being a highlight as it added a creamy decadence to the pizza.

**WILD NETTLES w/ Boccalone Pancetta, Portobella Mushrooms & Aged Provolone ($18) - 3 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9acPdpguULGPbChPwpS3aw?select=kgKHBnvAQ5ruvrQPWVXoGQ
The Wild Nettles pizza was our least favorite. Wild Nettles are a bit assertive in flavor; like a tart spinachy flavor. Too much was used in our pizza which overpowered and hindered the taste of the pancetta, Portobello, and provolone.

S E R V I C E
WHERE DO I BEGIN?

We sat at our table for a good 12 minutes without being acknowledged. There were 4 waiters for about 8 tables so it shouldn't have taken that long. 

When our waitress, Grace finally arrived (I got her name from our receipt), we told her we were ready to order. I waited for several seconds so she can take out her notepad which apparently she didn't need as she blurted, "You can start talking now..." Wow, rude much?

I looked around and we seemed to be the only ones without our own pitcher of water. Grace only filled my water halfway so when she brought our pizzas, I asked for more water and chili pepper flakes. That seemed to have hit a nerve with her. Grace looked down at her apron to grab the chili pepper shakers and gave me the most disturbing glare as she slowly sat the shakers on the table. My friends were all shocked at the way she looked at me.

I thought she probably felt bad because she later tried to make small talk with us. However, when I was on my phone taking notes for this review, my friends started laughing and sarcastically remarked, "She must not like you". Apparently, when they asked for the bill, she gave me "that" stare again.

As we were waiting for our change, I saw Grace talking to her co-worker. At the corner of my eye I saw her looking at me as she made this odd gesture while shaking her hips as if she was mocking me. She then caught me looking directly at her so she rushed over to us to thank us for coming in. At this point, I was completely stunned with what I just saw and walked out without even saying anything to her.

I've worked in the retail industry for years so I know how tough the service industry can be. I was always polite to Grace so I'm still scratching my head as to what I did to deserve her "bi- polar" behavior which is the best way I can describe it. Her bad attitude and disrespectful and strange behavior created one of the most uncomfortable dining experiences in my life. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Cozy and modern with rustic feel with wooden furnishings with black and white paintings.
