Bright red bricks line the walls and there is the typical black and white Italian grandmother photos. Also of interest is a giant spoon on one wall and drawings of animals and their meat parts on the other. The wine list at Ragazza is very small, but well thought out and they offer various obscure native Italian varietals by the glass and the bottle. But the food is to die for. We shared a farro salad with arugula, radishes, and snap-peas, and all I can say is it was like Springtime in a bowl. The soft polenta appetizer was rich and creamy and topped with mascarpone cheese. But the coup-de-grace was the pizza, a perfectly cooked Neapolitan style pie with wild nettles, sliced pancetta and portobello mushrooms. Needless to say, I couldn't let a single bite go to waste! The service at Ragazzo was also outstanding--really friendly, knowledgable servers who helped make the experience five-star.
author: Kareasa W.

description: I love this place. The pizza is delicious, as are the salads. The service is usually quick and attentive. The wait is often long, but it's worth it. I highly recommend Ragazza!
author: Lauren K.

description: It is like being at chic friends home for diner who happens to have a gas-fired Wood Stone oven and knows how to use it.  The food was delicious my favorites were the beet, avocado, grapefruit salad, the wild nettle pizza (amazing!) and the chocolate cake with pistachio nuts was perfection.  The atmosphere is warm, relaxed elegance, the people are kind, easy going and knowledgeable.  It is the ideal spot to celebrate an evening out-enjoy!
author: Sabrina S.

description: best pie in town . my only complaint is that they are too busy. that is the only thing saving me from being fat because i work at a bar across the street. luv this spot !
author: Chris L.

description: This brand new spot is an instant hit, with a simple, yet elegant decor, unbelievably friendly owner/chef and staff, and the best Italian food this side of North Beach.  Prices are reasonable, and dishes are simple, yet varied and immediately sensuous to the palate. It is a comfortable neighborhood place and a destination as well.  Get in on it before it becomes difficult to get in!
author: Dr. Terry P.

description: This was a great meal and might be the best neighborhood restaurant since I visited NOPA and far better prices. Excellent pasta, wine, pizza pie, and wonderful appetizers. All YUMMY
author: Heidi p.

description: best pizza in the city... then delfina then dellarosa then tony's then tomaso's then zero zero
author: nick g.

description: Excellent neighborhood restaurant. Not just another pizza place, but a good menu. Excellent kitchen. Very friendly service. Two of us shared a salad, main course and a pizza - worked out perfectly. Good simple selection of beer and wine.  Wouldn't suggest more than 6 in your party. We got there early mid-week - it fills up quickly. They're opening the garden area shortly, which will help.
author: Ron M.

description: This review is for my experience with the hostess only as she never bothered to seat my group. Last night, my friends & I attempted to eat at Ragazza.  My boyfriend & I have eaten there several times & wanted to introduce it to some friends.  I was with a party of six & we were told that the wait would be 50-75 minutes.  We left a name & number for her to call when our table was ready and then we went to get a drink.  After we finished our drinks, we returned to Ragazza.  The hostess told my friend she had called him repeatedly & had even left a message.  He verified that she had the correct number.  He did not have any missed calls or a message.  She then pointed out a table that was finishing up and told us she would seat us there.  We waited for the party to finish and the table to be set up for our group.  The hostess then proceeded to seat a different party of 6 at the table she had said was for my friends and me.  Two members of my party went inside to speak with the hostess & question her as to why she had seated a different party of six at the table she had said was for our group.  She never offered an apology or an explanation as to why she seated the other party or admitted any fault.  By that time, we had had enough of her attitude & took our business elsewhere.
author: Karen P.

description: Excellent thin crust pizza.  Get there prior to opening or be prepared to wait.  Went with friends, will definitely be back.
author: Joe J.

description: Expensive food for the Haight.  Tasty but small portions.
author: Jordan S.

description: My fingers are crossed that Ragazza finds a long term home in this space that's been a rotating restaurant gallery.  It's a much needed addition to the neighborhood.  Last Friday at 8:00 we put our name in for 4 and went to have cocktails at Madrone for about 45 minutes.  The nice hostess called my cell phone when the table was ready (15 minutes earlier than estimated)- so easy!  The wine list has some little gems and our server was really knowledgeable about the wine.  We settled on the Uva di Troja by Santa Lucia in Puglia which was great and  really well priced.  We moved on to Brussel Sprouts (with some salty pig fat) that were instantly devoured by my boyfriend before anyone else could even blink, and a beautiful, family style salad.  The pizzas were my favorite part.  The crust was thin and bubbly with a little char on the bottom.  They also offer the option of a sunny side up egg on top of the pizza to dip the crust in!  I am getting so hungry writing this review.  Ragazza is def. going into my rotation of neighborhood favorites!
author: R G.

description: great wine, good pizza, good times. sitting at the counter makes it quick and easy and you get to watch the pizza action up close.
author: sadao n.

description: Great intense flavors on the pizza (puttanesca), no problem seating us with no reservation on new years eve, service a tad kooky but perfectly good. Not the cheapest  but worth it, I think.
author: Tim H.

description: I was really looking forward to trying Ragazza, and went with friends tonight.  No reservations so we put our name on the list and where told 20 to 30 minutes, so we waited.  45 minutes later I checked, and was told just a minute.   A few minutes later the hostess came out and called someone elses name.  After waiting an hour with no explination or chance of getting in we gave up and went to Blue in the castro.  After getting seated and our water the hostess called and said our table at Ragazza was ready, I stated that went could not wait and she hung up, no sorry......  I will not go back - rude and where told 30 minutes when they knew it was an hour or more.  Thats just bad service
author: tim l.

description: First of all, the pizza here is delicious, with airy crusts that are comparable to those at Tony's Pizza Napoletana.  My friends and I devoured the heirloom tomato pizza with bacon (pushed into the crust!), a veritable garden of arugula, mozzarella, and bacon.  We were lucky to have it, at that, because heirloom season is almost over and these gorgeous tomatoes were at the peak of ripeness.  This wonderful course had been preceded by a tasty -- if too small -- antipasti of oven-roasted local sardines with Sicilian stuffing and breadcrumbs.  Dessert gave me a moment of pure bliss, an incredible instance of pairing perfection.  We ordered their olive oil cake with creme fraiche ice cream and figs.  Being out of figs, the dish was instead served with dates.  I ordered Vin Santo del Chianti Classico with this, and was floored by the perfect combination that turns out to be Vin Santo and figs.  Amazing!
author: Nick B.

description: Best pie in SF! Their sister restaurant, Gialina, is just as good.
author: tim b.

description: I live 2 blocks from this restaurant, and having gone at least once every two months for the last 3 years, I can confidently say it is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. The atmosphere is casual enough to feel comfortable rolling in on a whim, and nice enough to be a cozy date spot. The staff is always attentive and willing to answer any questions about new items on the menu or which wine to pick. The best part about this place is the consistency of the quality and the constantly changing menu. I eat here all the time, and there is always something new to try based on the season and where they are sourcing their ingredients. I've NEVER been disappointed here. Just give yourself plenty of time if it's a Friday or Saturday night, put in your name, grab a drink at The Page, and get nice and hungry so you can try at least two of their pizzas. PS: They are cheaper than almost any big, sloppy take-out pizza you could find elsewhere.
author: Mikayla C.

description: perfection. killer pies of a decent size. wonderful flavors. great price point. honest food- not fussy, not precious, no foam! Our server  Grace was an excellent guide for us as first timers. We will be back, Bella Ragazza!
author: Charlotte F.

description: I'm on the fence about Ragazza, the pizza was fantastic but we waited a long time for our pie and the app we ordered had little flavor. We started with the delicata squash app with ricotta, herbs, crushed almonds and currants. The dish sounded fantastic but was really lacking seasoning and wasn't served warm enough; it almost had a sweet dessert quality because of the ricotta and almond, but it really needed some salt. The margherita was fantastic with a sweet sauce, some bits of fresh mozz and super thin crust with crispy bubbly ends with fresh basil. The quality was superb and I didn't think $12.50 was a bad pirce. We wanted to try the chanterelle mushroom pie but I didn't want to spend $18. Also, you can add an egg to your pizza, yum.Their wine list may be nice but I wish they had a glass that was less than $9. Our service was okay, we sat at the bar and a fellow bar patron held the waiters attention the entire time, we went 20 mins without water refills and felt waiting 45 mins for a pizza was a bit long. I'd come back again for some pizza but wish they had more affordable wine menu and perhaps more veg friendly starters.
author: Cori W.

description: I wish you could get a good pizza in SF but you can't, especially at this place.  The Margherita was lousy.  The salad we had was good but I wouldn't come here for just salad and that means I wouldn't come here again.  Crummy beer selection and way-overpriced wine.  And VERY LOUD.
author: Mizu H.

description: This place has very good thin crust pizza and other italian dishes, nice ambiance plus the prices are reasonable.  My favorite is the Amatriciana pizza without the pancetta because I'm a vegetarian.  Its sister restaurant, Gialina, in Glen Park is also a big winner and it has more of a selection of pizza.  Still, the urban Divisadero vibe and the good food here is attractive!
author: Daniel S.

description: I have never written a bad review of any restaurant in SF, but I needed to write about the terrible service at Ragazza. I visited Ragazza a couple of weeks ago and ran into two of my friends outside, so I decided to join them at the bar, where there were two seats next to them.  My boyfriend was 10 minutes away on the bus, and the hostess refused to let me sit at the bar with my friends, even though I was going to eat dinner, because my boyfriend hadn't arrived yet.  I wanted to have a glass of wine with my friends and wait for my boyfriend before I ordered my food. The hostess shooed me away as if I were a nothing, and would not let me order a drink at the bar unless I was ordering food right then. She literally told me to go to the bar at the corner and have a drink while I waited for my boyfriend. I'm not the kind of person who drinks alone at a bar, especially when I can have a nice glass of wine with friends. The hostess clearly had a one-track mind for turn-over turn-over turn-over and $-$-$, rather than treating customers appropriately. There are many other places in the neighborhood that deal with much bigger crowds, like Little Star and Nopalito, and they do so with grace and good service, so I will gladly take my money there in the future.
author: Kate G.

description: This place has potential. If we got our pizza in a reasonable time and if was good, I'd easily rate a 4, but since neither happened, I give it a 2 or 2.5.  Our arugula salad was great. My date and I were starving, and our waitress indicated if we were hungry, get the large. So that was helpful. For pizza, we ordered the Hedgehog Mushrooms w/ provolone, ricotta, preserved lemon & Boccalone pancetta. To be honest all the pizzas looked good, our waitress was honest in indicating that she liked the potato w/applewood bacon one. So this is where my review turns sour. It took forever to get the pizza. Mind you this was a Thursday night, we were seated a little before 9pm. The restaurant by this time was only 1/2 full. We got our salad on time, and yet it took forever to get our pizza. In fact, I now remember our waitress initially was taking our order, someone dropped a glass, she excused herself to clean it up, then took about another 10 minutes to come back, was apologetic. So we order, get our salad, finish our salad. And wait. And wait some more. So after awhile, the restaurant is now 1/3 full, we're plainly sitting there, she looked at us like, "where's your pizza" to which we were, "you tell us"...I honestly thought she forgot to place the order.  A pizza comes out. Not ours. We get our pizza. We think it is the wrong one b/c we can't see any mushrooms on it, just what looks to be a solid, dark coating of the pancetta bacon crumbled up over 100% of the pizza (imagine not seeing any red of the tomato sauce.) The complaint both my date and I had was that there was a ridiculous amount of the pancetta, overwhelmingly so...it was crazy salty. could't taste the mushrooms, which our waitress upon ordering told us were similar to morels. We were ravenous at this point. So when there were two pieces left, neither of us wanted to have it boxed up. Our waitress had seen that i didn't order a 2nd glass of wine, and wanted to "splash some more wine" in my glass, apparently feeling bad for the long delay. After her 2nd entreaty, I relented for probably close to 1/2 a glass, but mind you at the 1st offer, I was so hungry, i didn't want to drink anything more on an empty-ish (salad only) stomach.  For dessert, after consulting our waitress, the only thing she steered us away from was the Nutella Pizza...we got and order of Bi Rite ice cream, Ricanelas (cinnamon with snickerdoodles). It was very small, but very, very good (as Bi Rite always is.) ...the only other thing I'd mention is that a lot of the staff were eating behind the bar...i mean, it was late, 10pm, and i could clearly see a handwashing station in the kitchen behind them, it's just that my date had waited tables before and said that she thought that unusual/unsanitary, but it's a tiny place...otherwise they'd have to eat before working their shift entirely, I suppose. Also, the staff kept opening the back door, so cold air kept blowing in...the waitress asked if we were ok with it, and she closed, but then they opened it again...so that wild mildly annoying...Like I said, I'd really rate 2.5, just that between the ridiculously long wait for thin crust pizza, which was not to our liking, it's hard to give even 3 stars, and could easily be a 4. A larger table next to us was very friendly making recommendations on pizza and pasta, having clearly enjoyed their meal. And it's a cute little place, very good for a date. I'd consider going again, but not too soon.
author: Matt B.

description: I'd heard about this restaurant and I love pizza.  I got a pizza to go & it smelled so good I could barely wait to get home.  I was sadly disappointed.  I got a pizza with 4 different cheeses that was very bland.  To make matters worse, halfway through a bite I discovered there was a hair in the pizza.  That really killed it.  I was willing to give the place the benefit of the doubt until then.  Otherwise, the restaurant's decor was really cute.
author: Jessica H.

description: Love the pizza - reminds you of the original, but slightly different. Not sure how to put my finger on it...but it's slightly different.
author: Jeannette L.

description: 2nd time here. Excellent, innovative food, great service, nice atmosphere. We had the RIcotta cheese with peach for desert. Never had anything like it and it tasted great.
author: Peter J.

description: The pizza crust is great, everything else falls flat.  Don't waste your time here.
author: Daniel B.

description: This place is terrible. The pizza was not very good and the salad was bitter. The tiramisu dessert was crunchy!! When is tiramisu ever supposed to be crunchy? The answer is, never! Our waitress even said it wasn't supposed to be crunchy and gave us a new one. Guess what, that one was crunchy too. The waitress said "oh well" and walked away. Our waitress was SO rude throughout the entire meal - terrible service. She was some blonde chick who acted like we were bothering her. When we asked for something, she just pointed to it with a sour look on her face instead of simply saying "the parmesan cheese is right here on the table." We would NEVER waste our time or money here again. SO many better places to go.
author: Carrie H.

description: I am a picky pizza eater and usually pass on pizza but the I love the nettles pizza here. The dough has a nice chew and slight crunch due to a good dough recipe and the pizza oven. It's silly but I like it so much it is hard to try anything else! While the pizzas and salads are great, the service is mixed. Sometimes the service is so inattentive...it's like just get me my pizza n-o-w so I can just eat it lol. I usually go there solo early and get a seat at the table facing the kitchen. It's a crowded place and the seating is cramped. I feel like I am eating with a straight jacket on (yet,  I am able to strategically angle my elbows outward, focus hard and not let this deter me from successfully completing my meal..ha)! This place fills up fast as the food is what keeps the people coming. Soooo go on a weeknight, go early, pick pizza and don't forget...elbows out! You can't go wrong with this "procedure" for getting in and out.
author: janice l.

description:
the best way to summarize our experience was that everything was just a little off.  

the beer selection was limited and not that great.  the usual italian beers and sierra nevada.  the pizzas were not constructed with as much attention to detail as you would expect.  big lumps of nettles instead of them being spread evenly over the pie and almost no preserved lemon.  also, the cheese on the margarita all came off in a single bite.  the crostini was over-salted so the taste of the cheese (stracchiatella) didnt come through as much as it should have.  

just as our pizza was served, after a longer than expected wait after our appetizer, the hostess sat another couple right next to us when there were many open tables not next to other guests.  not usually that bad except that they were wearing a lot of perfume which was distracting from the food.

the positives were that the crust on the pizza was delicious, the stracchiatella was great and the pizzas seemed to be well thought out.  the nettles pizza was good when you had the right bite but they were few and far between.

overall, we were disappointed.  with so many good pizza places i can not imagine going back unless we were already in the area and little star has a really long wait.
author: Andy P.

description: First time here and 1st impression TOO NOISY!!!! My dinner companion and I had to shout at each other through our entire meal.  I understand you have sound cushion thingy on the ceiling but it's not working.  Aside from the noise, the food was good overall. We started with the Oven Roasted Local Sardines which implied "more than one" and in fact it was "only one".  It was sooooo fishy and salty  it overpowered whatever stuffing was supposed to be inside.  Another table near us ordered it and it was all you could smell.  Next course the Braised Short Rib.  Though the taste and flavors were yummy & buttery and the pasta cooked just right, there was no bone just stringy meat.  The meat portion was plentiful but it could have used a little more pasta to soak up all the juices.  We ordered the Squash Blossom pizza with Pesto & Ricotta.  Lovely presentation, not too saucy which we loved.  Yummy buttery crust and somewhat yeasty but this just added to the flavor.  But the pizza was served on a cold plate so pizza didn't stay warm long and as we got to the last couple slices the crust became tough to cut and the crust became soggy.  We both really enjoyed the combination of ingredients on our pizza though and the size was adequate for 2.  To complete our dining experience we had the Flour-less Chocolate Cake (tough decision between this and the Cheesecake) which was heaven.  Moist, warm, lots of nuts, like a brownie on a plate.  Though we were told the whip cream was "flavored", it was not.  Given the dessert choices are quite good, I'd like to suggest a new one called "Black & White", which would consist of a 1/2 slice of Cheesecake and a 1/2 slice of Chocolate cake.  This way folks can try both for one price.  Bill came to $54 w/o drinks so a bit pricey in my book.  Would I go back, NO!  Again, the noise is so off-putting if I'm going to spend this much money I want to be able to enjoy the company of my dinner partner(s) without screaming.
author: Marla B.

description: This place is just around the corner from my house, and I'm excited to have them in the neighborhood. I came here with my boyfriend a few nights after they opened and we ordered a great bottle of wine, salumi plate, beet salad, roast pork, and nettle pizza. the salumi plate was good, although a few of the accompanying sauces tasted like they could use a little more work, the beet salad was absolutely amazing (and I'm not even a huge fan of beets), the roasted pork was good but not great, it tasted a little rushed and seemed to be missing something, the texture of the meat was good, but it lacked flavor. The nettle pizza was okay- I've never tried nettles before and was very curious but I found the flavor to be too strong, they almost tasted fishy (maybe that's what nettles are supposed to taste like but i wasn't in love) however, everything else about the pizza was good, and the other pizzas I saw looked great. The deserts we tried were a little on the dry side, but good. Service was great, the decorations are really cute, and the back patio area is going to be absolutely amazing once they get it set up. I wouldn't call it a destination restaurant, but I think it's a solid addition to the neighborhood and after they iron out a few of the newness kinks it's going to be great!
author: Lauren B.

description: Superb thin crust pizza, solid wine choices, and interesting salads and other starters.  Aparently the sibling to Gialina and much the same.  Busy at all hours, crowded, casual, and uncommon pizza topping combinations (we particularly liked the pear, arugula and prosciutto). Expect a wait and a noisy environment, while the casual-but-professional staff makes for a good experience.
author: tw s.

description: It's like Pizzeria Delfina without the mob wait. Actually, I still like Delfina a little better. The crust was slightly burnt and soggy in the middle but the flavors were on par with the top pizzerias in town.
author: Jeff H.

description: I am so happy for this addition to my neighborhood.  Everytime I have gone the food has been amazing, and I've had excellent service from the friendly wait staff.  My only complain is that they don't take reservations.  I really don't like waiting in line. But since everything there is so good, I tolerate the wait.
author: Lila B.

description: This restaurant is extremely noisy. They need something to soften the sound- drapes? carpeting? cushions on the benches. On top of the customer noise, they play music, not quiet music but someone singing which only adds to the noise. I don't see how anyone can enjoy their food when one has to shout to their dinner companion. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE...if the owners read this, please do something about the noise level!
author: Allen K.

description: I thought the food was overall great, but I was particularly impressed by their appetizers. We had the arugula w/ beets and goat cheese, pork belly salad, and soft polenta for appetizers. I'm really not such a big fan of salads but the greens were very fresh and both had just the right amount of cheese. And the polenta... oooh the polenta was soooo soft and creamy without being too rich. I didn't even know what polenta was until I had it that night lol... but it is now my favorite dish from Ragazza! Good thing it's not in my neighborhood, otherwise I'll be having polenta every night.
author: Leah S.

description:
it's good. a solid pizza joint in the hood.

don't get your panties in a bunch folks, it's pizza.
author: thad b.

description: Wonderful, friendly service.  Great Italian reds by the glass...delicious salads.  I ordered the same pizza I always get at Gialina's--the Puttanesca--even though it was not on the menu.  It arrived a bit undercooked, but still delicious.  Look forward to going back.
author: Bathsheba M.

description: Delicious pies, salad, pasta and wine. We went on a double date with our friends and it was fun! Can't wait to go back. Next time, we'll save room for dessert.
author: Missy D.

description: Put our name in and wandered down the street to have a glass of wine at the Wine Bar on the corner. Hostess called us when our table was ready. Had the lamb meatballs to start, nice beginning, very tender, smooth taste and they didn't over power them with a bunch of herbs or spices. i HAD to have to the nettles pizza as I had just been to the farmers market and had not only the vendor but shoppers telling me "you have to try them."  I figured I'd be preparing them at home the first time but lucked out and ordered the pizza with nettles, proscuitto type meat, etc. It was out of this world. We all LOVED it and I was some people who RARELY eat different greens and such. The crust is like a flat bread and is perfect as the shelf for the toppings but could hold its own as a cracker or bread.  Cute place in a great neighborhood. Noticed the back yard had a bunch of tables set up so does this mean more seating possibilities on nice summer nights?! Let's hope so!
author: P G.

description: I am really torn on this one.  I wanted to like it I really did. I liked Gialina. I liked the idea of this place, ie Gialina with a wider menu offering. I even thought that the place looked ok. But this really wasn't a very good meal at all. Have been to pizza places all across the city, and have had pizzas that were well cooked, undercooked, good ingredients, bad ingredients, you get the idea....  This is the first time that I have been to a restaurant where the pizza I was served was borderline inedible because of the amount of raw flour on the base of the pizza. It was bizarre. We had 4 pizzas on our table, and each one had the same issue. I am all for artisan bread with some flour dusted on the TOP of the bread BEFORE being thoroughly cooked in the oven, but there was so much flour packed in on the pizza base, that it never had a hope of cooking in the oven, and just ended up tasting bitter and chalky. Forgetting that for a moment, the crust itself was really bland, and had none of the delicious flavor of what I had at Gialina. How could the two places be so different? It's as different as chalk and cheese......
author: John S.

description: It pains me to write this as I love Gialina but this is now my second less than good experience at Ragazza. We made the mistake of ordering the incredibly overpriced starter of Stracchiatella with crostini. The cheese was fine but the crostini was... well there were 3 slices of crostini each about 2 inches long. The amount of cheese on the plate - while not generous by any sretch of the imagination - dwarfed the surface area of the "crostini" provided. Eating it with the crostini would have been akin to eating butter with a spoon. We asked for additional crostini and were met with a look of disdain and instead served up some rather unappealing "flatbread" about 10 minutes after we asked for it. As 2 people, we ordered this starter and 2 pizzas which were served one at a time. In theory this would be fine except that that second pie arrived ICE COLD. It was a Friday evening and the place was packed. Our server was absent - except when it came to delivering the check whcih was done without asking if we'd like dessert (we didn't, but still) and if everything was OK (our 2nd pizza was left mostly uneaten because it was so unappealing cold - note to readers:suncokes are not particularly tasty when cold).
author: AceGirl ..
